rotate

public static void rotate(byte[] array,
                          int from,

Throws:
SequenceArrayException

rotate

public static void rotate(byte[] array,
                          int from,
                          int to,
                          int size)
                   throws SequenceArrayException
Rotates an array slice in place within the larger array. Moves elements from the "from" end to the "to" end; so if from < to, the overall rotation is to the left.

Parameters:
array - a char array
from - the 0-based array index of the first column to move (inclusive)
to - the 0-based array index of the last column to move (inclusive)
size - the number of positions to rotate the slice. Can be negative to indicate rotation to the right.
Throws:
SequenceArrayException

Strip all gaps, left-justifying the sequences. Updates both the character array and the index array.
